name: An American in Paris Online Quiz | A | 10 Questions

questions.text: Singing and dancing dynamo of American cinema, Gene Kelly, starred in this film, as a former American GI who has made his home in Paris.  His character's given name is Jerry, what is his surname?
questions.explanation:
Mulligan.

	This film came at the high point in Gene Kelly's career.  In the following year (1952) would make his best-known and loved movie 'Singin' in the Rain'.  'An American in Paris' is arguably his #2 most beloved film.

questions.text: Still struggling to eke out a means of subsistence, what is the occupation of our hero Jerry?
questions.explanation:
Painter.

	Jerry has been inspired to paint by the beautiful surroundings of Paris.  His paintings resemble the works of the various French artists of the Impressionist genre.

questions.text: What is the somewhat strange given name of the woman who becomes Jerry's patroness (last name Roberts)?
questions.explanation:
Milo.

	Milo Roberts is played by Nina Foch.  She claims to be named for the Venus de Milo, a sculpture that just happens to reside in the Louvre in Paris.

questions.text: Which usual, writing partner of Frederick Loewe is credited with writing the screenplay for 'An American in Paris'?
questions.explanation:
Alan Lerner.

	Lerner and Loewe were famously paired in the writing and musical composition for a number of films, including 'Brigadoon', 'Gigi' and 'My Fair Lady'.  Lerner won an Oscar for 'Best Writing, Story and Screenplay' on this film.

questions.text: Which Academy Award-winning auteur directed this artsy film?
questions.explanation:
Vincente Minnelli.

	Minnelli, father of Liza Minnelli with Judy Garland, was an American-Italian born in Chicago.  He was nominated for 'An American in Paris' but did not bring home the Oscar that year.  He would win an Oscar seven years later for 'Gigi'.

questions.text: Several very popular songs were among those performed in this film, including 'I Got Rhythm' and 'S Wonderful'.  Who composed these famous tunes?
questions.explanation:
George Gershwin.

	George Gershwin composed the music and his brother Ira wrote the lyrics for these and a half dozen other songs for the film's soundtrack.  'I Got Rhythm' is performed in the film by Gene Kelly, while Kelly pairs up with Georges Guétary for 'S Wonderful'.

questions.text: Jerry finds himself in love with a beautiful French girl named Lise Bouvier.  Which actress/dancer made her film debut, portraying the lovely young Lise?
questions.explanation:
Leslie Caron.

	Leslie Caron would go on to have a long film career, appearing in such movies as 'Gigi', 'Is Paris Burning?' and 'Chocolat'.  Caron was born in France, where she began her career as a ballet dancer.

questions.text: What is the name of the man, played by Georges Guétary, who is rival to Jerry for the love of the beautiful young Lise?
questions.explanation:
Henri Baurel.

	Born Lambros Worldou, Georges Guétary was a famous French actor and singer who appeared in only one American-made film, namely 'An American in Paris'.

questions.text: Adam Cook is Jerry's close friend in the film, and a fine piano player to boot.  Which film composer, and sometimes actor, portrayed Mr. Cook in the film?
questions.explanation:
Oscar Levant.

	Oscar Levant composed the music for a number of films in the 1920s and 1930s, and also for the radio.  Levant was a close pal of George Gershwin, which explains his appearance in the film.

questions.text: 'An American in Paris' was nominated and won the Academy Award for 'Best Picture'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Indeed, 'An American in Paris' beat out such films as 'A Place in the Sun' and 'A Streetcar Named Desire' to win the award that year - quite an accomplishment! I hope you have enjoyed this quiz, thank you for playing.
